p: Momentum microscopes take k-space images directly on a linear k-scale, without necessary transformation. The complete separation of imaging column and long field-free ToF section avoids crosstalk of longitudinal and transversal momentum components [see, for example, Fig. 2 of Kühn et al. (2018 ▸)]. In other words, the isochrone planes are practically planar [dots on the trajectories in Figs. 2( b) and 2( c) ▸]. Imaging of the intermediate real-space image (PEEM mode) allows inspection of the sample surface. Moreover, it can be used as a precise monitor for the position of the photon footprint. For small photon spots like at beamline P22 the adjustable field aperture for selection of the region-of-interest on the sample is not needed.
